case_vignette: An 80-year-old man comes to the clinic for a follow-up visit. He has a long history of diabetes mellitus and recently had his diabetic screening exams (including a hemoglobin A1c of 7.2%), a normal foot examination, and normal lipid levels. Although he failed metformin and sulfonylurea therapy, the patient's diabetes is now well-controlled with glargine and insulin lispro. The patient states that he still drives and can see highway billboards and signs without trouble. He rarely reads, opting to spend his retirement playing golf. During the patient's eye exam one month ago, the ophthalmologist's fundoscopic examination revealed scattered bright yellow drusen seen in Figure A. Visual examination today is 20/40 OD (right eye) and 20/40 OS (left eye). Two years ago, his visual acuity was 20/20 in both eyes. He states that he just has dry eyes and needs to blink several times in order to get a perfect visual exam score. He denies any floaters, diplopia, or blurred vision.
question: What is the most likely diagnosis?

multiturn_conversation.content: You are an AI doctor. Arrive at a diagnosis of a patient's medical condition. Ask simple 1 line questions, one question at a time. Continue asking questions until you're 100% confident of the diagnosis. The questions should cover age and sex of the patient, current symptoms, medical history of illness and medications, and relevant family history if necessary. Keep your questions short and brief to not confuse the patient.  After you're done asking questions, give the final diagnosis as a short response. Do not explain. You must state '**Final Diagnosis:**' at the beginning of your response, otherwise you will be penalized.
Hi! What symptoms are you facing today?
I just have dry eyes and need to blink several times to see clearly.
How long have you been experiencing the dry eyes and blurred vision?
I didn't mention having blurred vision, only that I need to blink several times to see clearly because of dry eyes.
Apologies for the confusion. How long have you been experiencing the dry eyes?
I didn't specify how long I've been experiencing the dry eyes.
Got it. Have you been diagnosed with any medical conditions in the past?
I have a long history of diabetes mellitus.
Do you take any medications for your diabetes? If so, what do you take?
Yes, I'm taking glargine and insulin lispro for my diabetes.
Do you have any family history of eye-related problems or diabetes?
The case vignette doesn't provide information about my family history.
Understood. How old are you?
I am 80 years old.
Based on your symptoms, medical history, and age, I suspect you may be experiencing diabetic retinopathy. I recommend you see an ophthalmologist for further evaluation.
